title: Develop strategy for reducing orphaned pages (235 pages with no incoming links)
description:
## Context
Internal link validation revealed 235 pages (86% of site) have **ZERO incoming internal links**. This severely impacts:
- **SEO**: Search engines struggle to discover these pages (poor crawl depth)
- **User navigation**: Users can't find these pages except via Google/direct URL
- **PageRank distribution**: No internal link equity flowing to these pages

## Orphaned Pages Breakdown

**Examples of high-value orphaned pages:**
- `/guide/apa-graduate-students/` - Comprehensive guide, but nobody links to it
- `/guide/apa-title-page/` - Important guide, zero links
- `/guide/apa-reference-list/` - Critical guide, zero links
- `/cite-nature-apa/` - Specific source pages (most of the 195 PSEO pages)
- `/cite-science-apa/` - Similar issue
- And 230+ more pages...

## What "Orphaned" Means
A page exists in production, but no other page on the site links to it. Users/search engines can only reach it via:
- Direct URL entry
- Google search results
- External links

## Potential Strategies

### Option 1: Add "Related Resources" to PSEO Template (Medium effort)
Update PSEO template to include links to mega-guides in footer/sidebar:
- "APA Graduate Student Guide" ‚Üí `/guide/apa-graduate-students/`
- "Reference List Formatting" ‚Üí `/guide/apa-reference-list/`
- "Title Page Requirements" ‚Üí `/guide/apa-title-page/`

**Pros**: Easy to implement, gives mega-guides immediate link authority
**Cons**: Doesn't help specific source pages link to each other
**Regeneration**: ‚úÖ YES - all PSEO pages

### Option 2: Smart Related Content System (High effort)
Build algorithm to suggest related specific sources:
- For medical journals ‚Üí suggest other medical journals
- For physics journals ‚Üí suggest other physics journals
- Use journal categories/disciplines

**Pros**: Actually helpful to users, improves internal linking structure
**Cons**: Requires categorization system and development work
**Regeneration**: ‚úÖ YES - all PSEO pages + new logic

### Option 3: Just Remove Orphan Problem for Mega-Guides (Low effort)
Only fix the ~15 mega-guides by adding them to:
- Main site footer (Footer.jsx)
- PSEO template "Related Guides" section

Leave specific source pages orphaned (they'll get traffic from Google anyway)

**Pros**: Fast, targets highest-value content
**Cons**: Doesn't fix 85% of orphans
**Regeneration**: ‚ö†Ô∏è PARTIAL - Footer.jsx changes (no regen), PSEO template changes (regen required)

### Option 4: Defer for Now
Track this issue but don't fix yet. Focus on higher priority broken links first.

## Investigation Required
1. Categorize orphaned pages by type and priority
2. Review competitors' internal linking strategies
3. Estimate SEO impact of each approach
4. Decide which strategy to pursue

## Data Available
Full list of 235 orphaned pages in `seo_link_health_report.json`

## Decision Needed
Which strategy should we pursue? Or combination?

## Impact
Potential 50-100% increase in organic traffic from improved crawlability and internal link structure

## Objective

## Tests to Implement

### 1. Sitemap Completeness Test
```python
# tests/test_sitemap_sanity.py
import requests
from xml.etree import ElementTree as ET
from pathlib import Path

def test_sitemap_accessibility():
    """Sitemap should be accessible and valid XML"""
    resp = requests.get('https://citationformatchecker.com/sitemap.xml')
    assert resp.status_code == 200
    ET.fromstring(resp.content)  # Validates XML

def test_sitemap_url_count():
    """Sitemap should have minimum expected URLs"""
    resp = requests.get('https://citationformatchecker.com/sitemap.xml')
    root = ET.fromstring(resp.content)
    urls = root.findall('.//{http://www.sitemaps.org/schemas/sitemap/0.9}loc')
    
    MIN_EXPECTED_URLS = 200  # Adjust based on content
    assert len(urls) >= MIN_EXPECTED_URLS, f"Only {len(urls)} URLs, expected >= {MIN_EXPECTED_URLS}"

def test_content_directories_match_sitemap():
    """Content dirs should match sitemap URLs"""
    # Count cite-* directories
    cite_dirs = list(Path('/opt/citations/content/dist').glob('cite-*-apa'))
    
    # Count cite-* URLs in sitemap
    resp = requests.get('https://citationformatchecker.com/sitemap.xml')
    content = resp.text
    cite_urls = content.count('/cite-')
    
    # Allow 10% variance
    assert abs(len(cite_dirs) - cite_urls) / max(len(cite_dirs), 1) < 0.1
```

### 2. Random Content Sampling
```python
import random

def test_random_sitemap_urls_return_content():
    """Sample 10 random URLs from sitemap, verify they return real content"""
    resp = requests.get('https://citationformatchecker.com/sitemap.xml')
    root = ET.fromstring(resp.content)
    urls = [elem.text for elem in root.findall('.//{http://www.sitemaps.org/schemas/sitemap/0.9}loc')]
    
    # Sample 10 random URLs
    sample = random.sample(urls, min(10, len(urls)))
    
    for url in sample:
        resp = requests.get(url)
        assert resp.status_code == 200, f"{url} returned {resp.status_code}"
        
        # Verify not blank React app
        assert len(resp.content) > 10000, f"{url} returned only {len(resp.content)} bytes (likely blank)"
        
        # Verify contains actual content (not just React shell)
        assert b'cite' in resp.content.lower() or b'apa' in resp.content.lower()

def test_psychology_pages_work():
    """Critical pages that were previously broken"""
    urls = [
        'https://citationformatchecker.com/cite-developmental-psychology-apa/',
        'https://citationformatchecker.com/cite-consulting-clinical-psychology-apa/',
    ]
    
    for url in urls:
        resp = requests.get(url)
        assert resp.status_code == 200
        assert len(resp.content) > 25000  # Real content is ~32KB
```

### 3. Content vs Sitemap Drift Detection
```python
def test_no_orphaned_content():
    """All deployed content should be in sitemap"""
    # Get all content directories
    content_paths = list(Path('/opt/citations/content/dist').glob('*/'))
    content_slugs = {p.name for p in content_paths if p.is_dir()}
    
    # Get sitemap URLs
    resp = requests.get('https://citationformatchecker.com/sitemap.xml')
    sitemap_slugs = set()
    for line in resp.text.split('\n'):
        if '<loc>' in line:
            url = line.split('<loc>')[1].split('</loc>')[0]
            slug = url.rstrip('/').split('/')[-1]
            sitemap_slugs.add(slug)
    
    # Find orphans
    orphans = content_slugs - sitemap_slugs
    assert len(orphans) == 0, f"Orphaned content not in sitemap: {orphans}"

def test_no_missing_content():
    """All sitemap URLs should have actual content"""
    resp = requests.get('https://citationformatchecker.com/sitemap.xml')
    root = ET.fromstring(resp.content)
    urls = [elem.text for elem in root.findall('.//{http://www.sitemaps.org/schemas/sitemap/0.9}loc')]
    
    broken = []
    for url in urls:
        if '/cite-' in url or '/how-to-' in url:
            resp = requests.get(url)
            if resp.status_code != 200 or len(resp.content) < 10000:
                broken.append(url)
    
    assert len(broken) == 0, f"Broken URLs in sitemap: {broken[:10]}"
```

- [ ] Tests fail if content/sitemap drift detected
- [ ] Tests run on every deployment
- [ ] Tests catch the issue we just discovered

## Problem

URLs like `/cite-developmental-psychology-apa/` and other PSEO pages show blank pages with React Router error "No routes matched location".

## Root Cause

Commit 044814d (Nov 5, 2025 - "feat: add comprehensive analytics tracking") introduced React Router (`BrowserRouter`) which now intercepts ALL routes. Only 5 routes are defined: `/`, `/success`, `/privacy`, `/terms`, `/contact`

Any URL not matching these routes shows a blank page, even though nginx could serve static PSEO pages for those URLs.

## Solution

Revert to the previous conditional rendering pattern (before commit 044814d) but extend it to support the new pages (`/privacy`, `/terms`, `/contact`).

### Before (worked fine):
```jsx
function App() {
  if (window.location.pathname === '/success') {
    return <CreditProvider><Success /></CreditProvider>
  }
  return <CreditProvider><AppContent /></CreditProvider>
}
```
